If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [ ] It's submitted to the `dev` branch for v2.x (or to a previous version branch), _not_ the `master` branch
- [x] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)
- [ ] All tests are passing: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#development-setup
- [ ] New/updated tests are included

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [x] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)

**Other information:**

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Fix object notation error in navigation docs" (#1837) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
<!--
Please make sure to read the Pull Request Guidelines:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines
-->

### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/Twinpix/hgs7w26f/2/](https://jsfiddle.net/Twinpix/hgs7w26f/2/)

### Steps to reproduce
When changing to route A or Route B, Router should fire appear hook of Component on the first time and but enter hook is fired instead.

### What is expected?
I want to get a different transition/animation on the first load of components by vue-router, so I want to use appear hooks for this purpose.

### What is actually happening?
But it seems that appear hook can only fired on the first component that is loaded in <router-view>, even if appear hooks are defined at component level and not around  <router-view>.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Navigating between child routes causes parent route to re-render" (#1838) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle.net/yyx990803/L7hscd8h/](http://jsfiddle.net/yyx990803/L7hscd8h/)

### Steps to reproduce
Hi there!

In my app i have multiple nested routes:
```
- root
-- groups
--- all
--- group-details
---- group-posts
---- group-events
---- group-members
```
etc.
Based on this example: http://jsfiddle.net/yyx990803/L7hscd8h/ in my case `User` component re-rendered when i'm navigating between child routes

### What is expected?
when i'm navigating between child routes parent should't be re-rendered

### What is actually happening?
When i'm navigating between, let's say, `group-posts` and `group-events` parent route `group-details` also re-render.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
